metadata.title: USN-4484-1 -- Linux kernel vulnerability
metadata.description: It was discovered that the cgroup v2 subsystem in the Linux kernel did not properly perform reference counting in some situations, leading to a NULL pointer dereference. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service or possibly gain administrative privileges.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-4484-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  linux-image-5.3.0-1032-raspi2 - 5.3.0-1032.34 No subscription required  linux-image-5.3.0-1034-gke - 5.3.0-1034.36 linux-image-5.3.0-1034-aws - 5.3.0-1034.36 No subscription required  linux-image-5.3.0-66-generic - 5.3.0-66.60 linux-image-5.3.0-66-lowlatency - 5.3.0-66.60 No subscription required  linux-image-raspi2-hwe-18.04 - 5.3.0.1032.22 No subscription required  linux-image-gke-5.3 - 5.3.0.1034.19 No subscription required  linux-image-aws - 5.3.0.1034.33 No subscription required  linux-image-gkeop-5.3 - 5.3.0.66.123 No subscription required
